page.title: 02Transport: Cobham, w. Strood
page.content: Watling Street, an important Roman road, now the A2, passes through the area from London in the west to the Medway Towns, then Canterbury and Dover in the east. As the A2 approaches Strood, the M2 motorway begins, taking transport to the south and east, bypassing the Medway Towns. Much of the heavier traffic takes advantage of this motorway, especially between the capital and the Channel ports. The rural nature of Cobham Park means there are many public footpaths but very few roads within an area of some five square kilometres. Bus services for residents into the Medway Towns from western Strood are quite extensive.
